sourcesContent:
export const questionObj = {"Qtext": " 

Consider the adjoining figure. It is given that LJ is parallel to KM , and JL = 7 cm, JN = 4 cm, NK = 6 cm, and NM = 9 cm. Now, calculate LN and KM .
\newline
tikzpicture{}
\newline
[Figure not drawn to scale] \\
 ", "Steps": [{"id": "s1", "n_params": 0, "step_txt": "$$\text{In the triangle $JLN$ and triangle $KMN$ we have}$$
\[
	\angle J = \angle K 
\]
\[
	\angle JNL = \angle KNM 
\]"}, {"id": "s2", "n_params": 0, "step_txt": " $$\text{So, by using angle angle similarity we can write $\Delta JLN \sim \Delta KMN $}$$
\[
	\Rightarrow \frac{LN }{NM } = \frac{JN }{NK } = \frac{JL }{KM } 
\]"}, {"id": "s3", "n_params": 0, "step_txt": "
\[
	\Rightarrow \frac{LN }{9 } = \frac{4 }{6 } = \frac{7 }{KM }
\]
\[
	\Rightarrow LN = \frac{4 }{6 } \times 9 = 6.0 cm
\]

And
\[
	\Rightarrow KM = \frac{6 }{4 } \times 7 = 10.5 cm
\]
\newline

"}]} 

 export const resp = [{"data": [], "text": "$$\text{Since, LJ is parallel to KM, therefore, by alternate interor angle property, we have \angle J = \angle K, also, since vertically opposite angles are equal, therefore, \angle JNL = \angle KNM.}$$"}, {"data": [], "text": "$$\text{Sice, the ratio of corresponding sides in similar triangle is proportional, therefore, \frac{LN }{NM } = \frac{JN }{NK } = \frac{JL }{KM }}$$"}, {"data": [], "text": "$$\text{Putting the values in the previous equation we get $\frac{LN }{9 } = \frac{4 }{6 } = \frac{7 }{KM }$, which upon simplification gives us $LN = \frac{4 }{6 } \times 9 = 6.0 cm$ and $KM = \frac{6 }{4 } \times 7 = 10.5 cm$ "}]
